Instead of tweeting hyperbole, @POTUS should focus on real challenges in our economy: 

-How incomes haven’t kept pace with costs
-How automation has put pressure on workers
-How inequality continues to rise

Those are issues worth talking about.

html: On the 55th anniversary of the #EqualPayAct, it’s unacceptable that women still make just 80₵ for every $1 a man earns. That's why I support the #PaycheckFairnessAct, so we can eliminate the wage gap and ensure that women earn equal pay for equal work.
text:
On the 55th anniversary of the #EqualPayAct, it’s unacceptable that women still make just 80₵ for every $1 a man earns. 

That's why I support the #PaycheckFairnessAct, so we can eliminate the wage gap and ensure that women earn equal pay for equal work.

html: Coloradans want to take the long view and invest in our state’s future. To do this, we cannot neglect our schools. As a first step, we must find some way to prune the fiscal underbrush that threatens so deeply our investments in the future. Our children deserve better.
text: Coloradans want to take the long view and invest in our state’s future. To do this, we cannot neglect our schools. As a first step, we must find some way to prune the fiscal underbrush that threatens so deeply our investments in the future. Our children deserve better.

html: Shrinking state budgets have increased class sizes, reduced vital support for students like mental health services & special education, and sometimes slashed school weeks to 4 days. We cannot allow mindless budget shortfalls to force wrongheaded changes to our kids' education.
text: Shrinking state budgets have increased class sizes, reduced vital support for students like mental health services & special education, and sometimes slashed school weeks to 4 days. We cannot allow mindless budget shortfalls to force wrongheaded changes to our kids' education.

html: A few important stats: Colorado teachers are now earning less than they did 15 years ago, when compared to inflation. The gap between what a college graduate makes as a teacher and what she could make in another profession in our state is the largest in the country.
text: A few important stats: Colorado teachers are now earning less than they did 15 years ago, when compared to inflation. The gap between what a college graduate makes as a teacher and what she could make in another profession in our state is the largest in the country.

html: The bipartisan #opioidbill we passed in the HELP Committee this week brings us one step closer to combating the epidemic. We secured three provisions in the bill that will help decrease opioid use & provide those with substance use disorders the most innovative treatments faster.

html: In too many Colorado counties, hospitals are overwhelmed w/shortage of beds & specialists; courts are barely staying above water; jails are crowded b/c of limited resources for #opioid addiction treatment. We must invest in broader effort to respond to a crisis of this magnitude.

html: Today, the @FCC’s repeal of #NetNeutrality officially takes effect. We must fight back to keep the internet open & free. All we need in the Senate is #OneMoreVote to pass a resolution to protect Colorado’s internet users. Help us find that vote.

html: Under #GOPTaxBill, 90 mil Americans making less than $50k/year see an avg of $192 extra in their pockets. Compare that to the 572,000 Americans at the top who now make over $1 mil extra/year. They will receive an avg tax cut of $64k this year. How does that make sense? #TaxDay

html: As the Editorial Board points out: “Reduction in quality leads to a reduction of trust.” In a hyper-partisan &“fake news” oriented world, a lack of trust in local papers is the last thing our society needs. A free & vigilant press is essential to our function as a democracy.

html: When I was Superintendent of Denver Public Schools, Rocky Mountain News & @DenverPost held each other accountable—resulting in accurate, high-quality journalism. I often say my job would have been very different were it not for reliable & objective local press.
text: When I was Superintendent of Denver Public Schools, Rocky Mountain News & @DenverPost held each other accountable—resulting in accurate, high-quality journalism. I often say my job would have been very different were it not for reliable & objective local press.

html: A bit of a long thread coming up, but it’s an issue I’ve felt strongly about my entire career—and even more so over the last few years, as we’ve seen a shift away from edited content toward partisan press.

html: Thinking back to a quote that drives the work I strive to do each day to leave this country better for our kids: "There is nothing new about poverty...What is new...is that we now have the resources, we now have the skills, we now have the technique to get rid of poverty." #MLK50
text:
Thinking back to a quote that drives the work I strive to do each day to leave this country better for our kids:
"There is nothing new about poverty...What is new...is that we now have the resources, we now have the skills, we now have the technique to get rid of poverty." #MLK50

html: #ConnectColorado is a new initiative to help close the digital divide in our state. First up: Helping rural communities compete for $600 million in federal funding (secured in yesterday’s spending bill) by ensuring federal agencies provide timely answers to potential applicants.
text: #ConnectColorado is a new initiative to help close the digital divide in our state. First up: Helping rural communities compete for $600 million in federal funding (secured in yesterday’s spending bill) by ensuring federal agencies provide timely answers to potential applicants.

html: Colorado’s local leaders, especially in rural areas, have been at the forefront of innovative approaches to deliver high-speed, reliable, and affordable broadband to their communities. We must do everything we can to build on their work. That’s why I'm launching #ConnectColorado.

html: Inspired by activism of CO students taking a stand against gun violence. “School is supposed to be a place where you go to take the next steps into your life…not a place where all of that is taken away in seconds" -Chaparral HS student Cassidy Ramsey We must take action now.
text:
Inspired by activism of CO students taking a stand against gun violence. 

“School is supposed to be a place where you go to take the next steps into your life…not a place where all of that is taken away in seconds" -Chaparral HS student Cassidy Ramsey

We must take action now.

html: When did mass shootings become a normal part of American life? There's an entire generation growing up in fear that their school will be next. My thoughts are with families of victims & first responders in FL, but I also know that thoughts are not enough. It's time for action.
text: When did mass shootings become a normal part of American life? There's an entire generation growing up in fear that their school will be next.  My thoughts are with families of victims & first responders in FL, but I also know that thoughts are not enough. It's time for action.

html: A good reminder from Frederick Douglass on his 200th birthday: "Principles contained in [the Declaration of Independence] are saving principles. Stand by those principles, be true to them on all occasions, in all places, against all foes, and at whatever cost.” #BlackHistoryMonth

html: Could not agree more w/ Jen N. from Boulder, who says she doesn’t want buzzwords or vague statements—she wants concrete plans & actions. Tonight’s #SOTU is about more than tone & rhetoric. It’s about looking to action in the next year. 10/10

html: In #SOTU, Coloradans want @POTUS to reaffirm his commitment to the rule of law & respect for our institutions. Bruce S. from Denver says he wants to hear about “playing by the rules, and that no one, including the President, is above the law.” 9/x
text:
In #SOTU, Coloradans want @POTUS to reaffirm his commitment to the rule of law & respect for our institutions. 
Bruce S. from Denver says he wants to hear about “playing by the rules, and that no one, including the President, is above the law.” 9/x

html: In #SOTU, Coloradans want to hear that interference in our democracy will not be tolerated & we are taking steps to prevent such attacks from Russia—or others—in the future. Karl H. says he hopes addressing foreign interference in politics “wouldn’t be a partisan issue.” 8/x
text:
In #SOTU, Coloradans want to hear that interference in our democracy will not be tolerated & we are taking steps to prevent such attacks from Russia—or others—in the future. 
Karl H. says he hopes addressing foreign interference in politics “wouldn’t be a partisan issue.” 8/x

html: In #SOTU, Coloradans want to hear commitment to protect #Dreamers & keep families together. Rita M. from Englewood wants to hear @POTUS address DACA. “We surely need to allow [#Dreamers] who were brought here from another country as children to become American citizens.” 7/x
text:
In #SOTU, Coloradans want to hear commitment to protect #Dreamers & keep families together.

html: In #SOTU, Coloradans want to hear plans to #ActOnClimate, like building resilient infrastructure, modernizing electricity grid & promoting bipartisan clean energy policies. Deana K. from CO Springs says “CO has no snow this year” & asks how admin will slow #climatechange. 6/x
text:
In #SOTU, Coloradans want to hear plans to #ActOnClimate, like building resilient infrastructure, modernizing electricity grid & promoting bipartisan clean energy policies.

html: In #SOTU, Coloradans want to know how we'll prepare our kids for 21st century economy. This means growing wages to keep up with the costs of housing, health care, and childcare. It means modernizing #highered & career & technical ed so students are ready for jobs of tomorrow. 5/x

html: Last October, @POTUS declared the #opioid epidemic a public health emergency, but hasn’t proposed new resources or funding to combat the growing problem. Tonight, we want to know precisely how he plans to work with communities to prioritize this crisis. #SOTU 4/x
text: Last October, @POTUS declared the #opioid epidemic a public health emergency, but hasn’t proposed new resources or funding to combat the growing problem. Tonight, we want to know precisely how he plans to work with communities to prioritize this crisis. #SOTU 4/x

On 9th anniversary of Lily Ledbetter Fair Pay Act, we celebrate progress made & recognize work still to do. Let's ensure our laws align w/ ideals & eliminate pay discrimination for good.

html: What do you want to hear in tomorrow’s State of the Union? Share the issues that are important to you with hashtag #VoicesOfCO. Tomorrow, I’ll be sharing the vision that I want to hear in the #SOTU, and I want input from Coloradans as we look to priorities for the year ahead.
text:
What do you want to hear in tomorrow’s State of the Union? Share the issues that are important to you with hashtag #VoicesOfCO.

html: Later today, the Senate is voting on a 20-week abortion ban, jeopardizing a woman’s right to make her own healthcare decisions. I have voted against this measure in the past, and I will do so again. #NoAbortionBan
text: Later today, the Senate is voting on a 20-week abortion ban, jeopardizing a woman’s right to make her own healthcare decisions. I have voted against this measure in the past, and I will do so again. #NoAbortionBan

html: FBI Deputy Director McCabe is a public servant, and @POTUS’ attacks on him undermine our democratic institutions. FBI investigations should be entirely free from political influence or intimidation. The independence of the agency is critical to the rule of law.
text:
FBI Deputy Director McCabe is a public servant, and @POTUS’ attacks on him undermine our democratic institutions. 

FBI investigations should be entirely free from political influence or intimidation. The independence of the agency is critical to the rule of law.

html: This wkd, reflected on my family’s history surviving the Holocaust, while at the same time seeing troubling headlines in France & Poland that remind us anti-semitism is very much alive. Now more than ever, #WeRemember & commit to this never happening again. #HolocaustMemorialDay

html: There is no one else who can help the #Dreamers except for us—100 senators—and our colleagues in the House. It’s been our tendency to avoid these issues, but we don’t have that choice anymore. Families are being broken up every day. It’s long past time for us to do our job.

html: We treat the lives that are affected by the decisions we make—often by the decisions we don’t make—as collateral damage of someone we don’t concern ourselves with. What kind of governing is that? #Dreamers are looking to us & counting on us right now.

html: Our bipartisan #DACA deal is not “dead.” Democrats and Republicans negotiated in good faith and came to an agreement that protects Dreamers and increases border security. We’ll keep working to build support for this deal. I urge my colleagues to join me in doing the right thing.
text: Our bipartisan #DACA deal is not “dead.” Democrats and Republicans negotiated in good faith and came to an agreement that protects Dreamers and increases border security. We’ll keep working to build support for this deal. I urge my colleagues to join me in doing the right thing.

html: Today, we honor Dr. King by marching, but we can’t stop there. Tomorrow, we must continue his work by -demanding all kids have access to high-quality school -defending Dreamers & African immigrants -standing up when someone, especially the President, offends our deepest valuespic.twitter.com/rDEZklBFlx
text:
Today, we honor Dr. King by marching, but we can’t stop there. Tomorrow, we must continue his work by
-demanding all kids have access to high-quality school
-defending Dreamers & African immigrants
-standing up when someone, especially the President, offends our deepest valuespic.twitter.com/rDEZklBFlx

html: “Now is the time to make real the promises of democracy.” Dr. King, 1965 That cause – fulfilling the promise of our democracy – is how Dr. King understood patriotism, and it is the work of every American and every Coloradan. #Marade #MLKDaypic.twitter.com/j4ZHyjNpsR

html: Today, we honor Dr. King not because he died for justice, but because he lived for justice. He understood that the phrase “all men are created equal” was never a guarantee; it was a promise to be fulfilled by every generation of Americans. #Marade #MLKDaypic.twitter.com/a1zQXFDXbC

html: Last week, oil companies had the chance to bid on 10.3 million acres open for drilling in Alaska. In the end, less than 1% of the land was leased. We’re not even using all of the land now available for drilling. It defies reason that we would open up even more. #ProtectTheArctic
text:
Last week, oil companies had the chance to bid on 10.3 million acres open for drilling in Alaska. In the end, less than 1% of the land was leased. 
We’re not even using all of the land now available for drilling. It defies reason that we would open up even more. #ProtectTheArctic
